column4: hello, I am new to ubuntu and I was wondering how I can get k3b to burn cds because it says it is missing cdrdao.
package cdrdao has no installation candidate
so you should be able to install it using synaptic
are you running ubuntu or kubuntu ?
ok, well, you can use apt-get install for cdrdao as well
I do that but then it tells me its not available.
synaptic is just a GUI interface to similar functionality
you need to make sure 'universe' is enabled
how do I go about that?
i presume you edited /etc/apt/sources.list at some point ?
this was all default, didn't edit it at all.
ok, apt-get update and apt-get install cdrdao, and you should be up and running
